alert.note: Alert for Northeast Siskiyou and Northwest Modoc Counties (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 16 at 1:46PM PST until January 16 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Freezing rain is the main concern, although periods of ice pellets and sleet could be mixed in. Ice accumulation amounts of 0.01" to 0.1" are expected. * WHERE...In California, Northeast Siskiyou and Northwest Modoc Counties. In Oregon, Klamath Basin. This includes Klamath Falls, Midland, Keno, and Olene. This also includes portions of Highways 39, 140, 62, 66 and 97. * WHEN...From noon today to 4 PM PST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The wintry mix of precipitation is expected to change to rain between 4pm and 8pm. Then, a mix of rain and snow is expected, with the snow level around 4500 feet. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com and http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.

area.areaDesc: Northeast Siskiyou and Northwest Modoc Counties
